text: this absolutely does not warrant making a breaking change to the whole ecosystem

elements.text: this absolutely does not warrant making a breaking change to the whole ecosystem

text: is it really breaking to the “whole” ecosystem? It would only affect packages which exist with the same name and UUID in two registries, which I imagine is a pretty small %. (But I agree the approach might not be the best one and it would be better to not break anything if possible)

elements.text: is it really breaking to the “whole” ecosystem? It would only affect packages which exist with the same name and UUID in two registries, which I imagine is a pretty small %. (But I agree the approach might not be the best one and it would be better to not break anything if possible)

text: Breaking that use case would break things for a significant set of people

elements.text: Breaking that use case would break things for a significant set of people

text: Is this a JuliaPro problem? Apart from that I can only see that it would affect a small number of highly competent organizations who could add those few `shadowable` tags quickly and well in advance of deploying a Julia version that would take them into account. (Not saying that it's a non-issue but I want to understand the impact.)
